path_1.title: 22 Jump Street (2014)
path_1.feeling: Same goofy chemistry with a few solid laughs, fun but nothing special.

path_1.title: Fanboys (2009)
path_1.feeling: Nerdy road-trip hijinks hit my sweet spot more often than not.

path_1.title: Despicable Me 2 (2013)
path_1.feeling: Cute and zippy, but the kid-friendly antics wear thin for me.

path_1.title: Freaky Friday (2003)
path_1.feeling: Light body-swap fluff that’s fine once and done.

path_1.title: Change-Up, The (2011)
path_1.feeling: Raunchy gags are hit-or-miss and it coasts on the premise.

path_1.title: Saw (2003)
path_1.feeling: Grim survival-game vibe works, even if it feels rough around the edges.

path_1.title: Tunnel, The (2011)
path_1.feeling: Solid found-footage tension with a decent creep factor.

path_1.title: Grudge, The (2004)
path_1.feeling: Moody and spooky enough to keep me engaged.

path_1.title: 10 Cloverfield Lane (2016)
path_1.feeling: Tight, claustrophobic suspense that keeps me guessing.

path_1.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding (2002)
path_1.feeling: Pleasant but syrupy, with mild laughs.

path_1.title: Paul (2011)
path_1.feeling: Sci-fi jokes land sometimes, but overall it’s pretty middling.

path_1.title: Meet the Parents (2000)
path_1.feeling: Awkward gags mostly work even if it drags.

path_1.title: The Hitman's Bodyguard (2017)
path_1.feeling: Loud banter and shootouts are fun in spots but forgettable.

path_1.title: [REC] (2007)
path_1.feeling: Intense and frantic with a great payoff for found-footage horror.

path_1.title: Dogma (1999)
path_1.feeling: Clever idea, but the talky satire wears thin for me.

path_1.title: Frontière(s) (2007)
path_1.feeling: Mean, nasty, and brutal in a way I dig for horror.

path_1.title: Terminal, The (2004)
path_1.feeling: Sweet but soft, not my flavor of drama.

path_1.title: Alien (1979)
path_1.feeling: Slow-burn dread and creature terror done right.

path_1.title: Semi-Pro (2008)
path_1.feeling: Ferrell silliness gets some laughs but isn’t top-tier.

path_1.title: Due Date (2010)
path_1.feeling: Odd-couple road mayhem with more misses than hits.

path_1.title: Wicker Man, The (2006)
path_1.feeling: Campy and clumsy—more awkward than scary.

path_1.title: 10 Cloverfield Lane (2016)
path_1.feeling: Still a taut bunker thriller with satisfying tension.

path_1.title: No Strings Attached (2011)
path_1.feeling: Rom-com formula with a few chuckles, mostly meh.

path_1.title: Saw (2004)
path_1.feeling: Grim puzzle-box horror that scratches my itch.

path_1.title: Little Fockers (2010)
path_1.feeling: Tired rehash with thin laughs.
Earnest and funny enough, though a bit soft for my taste.

path_1.title: Ride Along (2014)
path_1.feeling: Buddy-cop shtick that’s serviceable, not memorable.

path_5.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding (2002)
path_5.feeling: Warm, broad culture-clash humor that mostly left me shrugging.

path_5.title: Paul (2011)
path_5.feeling: Nerdy sci‑fi quips and road gags land sporadically, overall middling.

path_5.title: Meet the Parents (2000)
path_5.feeling: Cringe-comedy set pieces that still work

path_5.title: The Hitman's Bodyguard (2017)
path_5.feeling: Loud, quippy shootouts—watchable junk food that fades fast.

path_5.title: [REC] (2007)
path_5.feeling: Ferocious found-footage terror with real bite

path_5.title: Dogma (1999)
path_5.feeling: Talky, sermon-heavy satire with some zingers, but the preachiness wore me down.

path_5.title: Frontière(s) (2007)
path_5.feeling: Mean, grimy splatter with political bile—gnarly brutality right up my alley.

path_5.title: Terminal, The (2004)
path_5.feeling: Gentle, syrupy airport fable that felt too cozy and mild for me.

path_5.title: Alien (1979)
path_5.feeling: Slow-burn space dread and creature nastiness that still crawls under my skin.

path_5.title: Semi-Pro (2008)
path_5.feeling: Loose, shaggy Ferrell antics—some laughs, mostly benchwarmers.

path_5.title: Due Date (2010)
path_5.feeling: Odd-couple road chaos with a few sharp hits amid plenty of filler.

path_5.title: Wicker Man, The (2006)
path_5.feeling: Campy misfire—unintentionally funny, but the horror falls flat.

path_5.title: 10 Cloverfield Lane (2016)
path_5.feeling: A taut, nervy chamber piece—tension and turns keep it humming.

path_5.title: No Strings Attached (2011)
path_5.feeling: Glossy sex-friends romcom that dragged and left me cold.

path_5.title: Saw (2004)
path_5.feeling: Grimy, ingenious trap thriller that kicks off the nastiness I enjoy.

path_5.title: Little Fockers (2010)
path_5.feeling: Tired retread gags with a few chuckles
Earnest cancer dramedy with some wit, but the uplift didn’t move me.

path_5.title: Ride Along (2014)
path_5.feeling: By-the-numbers buddy-cop bustle with a handful of decent laughs.

path_5.title: 22 Jump Street (2014)
path_5.feeling: Self-aware sequel gags hit here and there, but it's more noise than laughs for me.

path_5.title: Fanboys (2009)
path_5.feeling: Nerd-roadtrip silliness with enough heart and in-jokes to keep me grinning.

path_5.title: Despicable Me 2 (2013)
path_5.feeling: Colorful, harmless kid stuff that goes down easy but isn't my thing.

path_5.title: Freaky Friday (2003)
path_5.feeling: Body-swap charm is fine, but the Disney gloss keeps me at arm’s length.

path_5.title: Change-Up, The (2011)
path_5.feeling: Crass body-swap bits land sporadically

path_5.title: Saw (2003)
path_5.feeling: Lean, nasty proof-of-concept that scratches the grim puzzle-horror itch.

path_5.title: Tunnel, The (2011)
path_5.feeling: Solid found-footage chills with a good hook, if a little familiar.

path_5.title: Grudge, The (2004)
path_5.feeling: Creepy curses and sound design work, but the PG-13 jitters only go so far for me.

path_5.title: 10 Cloverfield Lane (2016)
path_5.feeling: Tense bunker mind games that kept me clenched, even if the landing's tidy.

path_5.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding (2002)
path_5.feeling: Cute culture-clash hijinks that mostly bounce off me.

path_5.title: Paul (2011)
path_5.feeling: Geeky riffs and road-movie vibe are decent, but laughs are hit-or-miss.

path_5.title: Meet the Parents (2000)
path_5.feeling: Cringe-comedy of errors that delivers steady, if safe, laughs.

path_5.title: The Hitman's Bodyguard (2017)
path_5.feeling: Loud, quippy buddy mayhem that entertains in bursts and fades fast.

path_5.title: [REC] (2007)
path_5.feeling: Relentless, claustrophobic terror that hits my nastier-horror sweet spot.

path_5.title: Dogma (1999)
path_5.feeling: High-concept sermonizing with scattered laughs—too talky for my taste.

path_5.title: Frontière(s) (2007)
path_5.feeling: Grimy, brutal Euro-horror that delivers the mean streak I crave.

path_5.title: Terminal, The (2004)
path_5.feeling: Polite, whimsical dramedy that left me detached.

path_5.title: Alien (1979)
path_5.feeling: Slow-burn dread and creature nastiness done right—still gnarly.

path_5.title: Semi-Pro (2008)
path_5.feeling: Goofy Ferrell antics with a few winners, mostly middling.

path_5.title: Due Date (2010)
path_5.feeling: Odd-couple road rage with chuckles, nothing I’ll revisit.

path_5.title: Wicker Man, The (2006)
path_5.feeling: Campy, misfired remake that bungles atmosphere and scares.

path_5.title: 10 Cloverfield Lane (2016)
path_5.feeling: Still a taut, bottled thriller with nerve and a neat mean streak.

path_5.title: No Strings Attached (2011)
path_5.feeling: Glossy rom-com sex pact that felt canned and weightless to me.

path_5.title: Saw (2004)
path_5.feeling: Grimy, twisty trap thriller that satisfies my nasty streak.

path_5.title: Little Fockers (2010)
path_5.feeling: Worn-out family hijinks that feel sitcom-flat.
Earnest cancer dramedy with a few laughs, but the uplift feels prefab.

path_5.title: Ride Along (2014)
path_5.feeling: Generic buddy-cop banter and boom—watchable, forgettable.
